title: Polynomial-Time Algorithms for Continuous Metrics on Atomic Clouds of Unordered Points
abstract:
Abstract
The most fundamental model of a molecule is a cloud of unordered atoms, even without chemical bonds that can depend on thresholds for distances and angles.
The strongest equivalence between clouds of atoms is rigid motion, which is a composition of translations and rotations.
The existing datasets of experimental and simulated molecules require a continuous quantification of similarity in terms of a distance metric.
While clouds of mùëöm ordered points were continuously classified by Lagrange‚Äôs quadratic forms (distance matrices or Gram matrices), their extensions to mùëöm unordered points are impractical due to the exponential number of m!ùëöm! permutations.
We propose new metrics that are continuous in general position and are computable in a polynomial time in the number mùëöm of unordered points in any Euclidean space of a fixed dimension nùëõn.
